fromString:
When you go to open a saved pipeline or save a pipeline from text in the pipeline builder, the UI prompts you:

 

{color:#1a1a1a}Are you sure you want to open this pipeline?{color}
Opening this project will abandon *unsaved* changes to the current pipeline you are building.
 
However, there is nothing to abandon because I just opened the aggregation tab.
toString:
When you go to open a saved pipeline or save a pipeline from text in the pipeline builder, the UI prompts you:

 

{color:#1a1a1a}Are you sure you want to open this pipeline?{color}
 Opening this project will abandon *unsaved* changes to the current pipeline you are building.
  
 However, there is nothing to abandon because I just opened the aggregation tab. I have a video if this is unclear.
author: dan@10gen.com

toString: This issue is related to COMPASS-1173
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
A user might want to specify read tag set on specific db servers and only want queries going to those servers. This can be done by setting readPreferenceTags in the connection string but there is no equivalent option in Compass.

 

Intercom conversation : https://app.intercom.io/a/apps/p57suhg7/inbox/inbox/2874483/conversations/20473745764
toString:
A user might want to specify read tag set on specific db servers and only want queries going to those servers. This can be done by setting readPreferenceTags in the connection string but there is no equivalent option in Compass.

 

Intercom conversation : https://app.intercom.io/a/apps/p57suhg7/inbox/inbox/2874483/conversations/20473745764

As Atlas uses tags to identify Analytics nodes, it'd be useful to extend the connect screen with readPreference tags.
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
Hi there,

I've downloaded Compass {{1.17.0-beta.5}} but cannot get it to authenticate against a shared or dedicated Atlas cluster. The error always returned is:

{noformat}
authentication fail
{noformat}

Using the same connection details with {{1.17.0-beta.4}} and {{1.16.3}} allows me to connect fine.

I've tried both SRV records and non-SRV records and neither work.

Looking in my dedicated cluster's {{mongod}} logs, I do not see any indication of an authentication failure, so suspect the error being returned isn't the actual issue.

FWIW, the shared cluster is running MongoDB 4.0.5, and the dedicated cluster is running 3.6.9.

Please let me know if I can provide any further info.

--Matt
toString:
Hi there,

I've downloaded Compass {{1.17.0-beta.5 (Beta)}} but cannot get it to authenticate against a shared or dedicated Atlas cluster. The error always returned is:

{noformat}
authentication fail
{noformat}

Using the same connection details with {{1.17.0-beta.4 (Beta)}} and {{1.16.3 (Stable)}} allows me to connect fine.

I've tried both SRV records and non-SRV records and neither work.

Looking in my dedicated cluster's {{mongod}} logs, I do not see any indication of an authentication failure, so suspect the error being returned isn't the actual issue.

FWIW, the shared cluster is running MongoDB 4.0.5, and the dedicated cluster is running 3.6.9.

Please let me know if I can provide any further info.

--Matt
author: matthew.thompson

fromString:
The [install_compass script on Windows|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/master/src/mongo/installer/compass/Install-Compass.ps1.in] is currently unable to download the Compass installer .exe. It is unable to negotiate TLS for some reason. We can test the [ultimate command that fails|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/master/src/mongo/installer/compass/Install-Compass.ps1.in#L41], see the attached screenshot for an example. 

The download *does* seem to work in the Firefox and Edge web browsers, but curl also seemed to fail in negotiating TLS.

Perhaps the browsers are more lax... Did we make any recent changes to the TLS cert used for this API?

It may be that we need to add some additional code to the script, but the script was working as-is AFAIK.

toString:
The [install_compass script on Windows|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/master/src/mongo/installer/compass/Install-Compass.ps1.in] is currently unable to download the Compass installer .exe. It appears unable to negotiate TLS for some reason. We can test the [ultimate command that fails|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/master/src/mongo/installer/compass/Install-Compass.ps1.in#L41] (see the attached screenshot as well):
{code:java}
PS C:\Windows\system32> Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://compass.mongodb.com/api/v2/download/latest/compass-community/stab
le/windows -OutFile foo.exe
Invoke-WebRequest : The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://compass.mongodb.com/api/v2/download/la ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 + CategoryInfo : InvalidOperation: (System.Net.HttpWebRequest:HttpWebRequest) [Invoke-WebRequest], WebExc
 eption
 + FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletWebResponseException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeWebRequestCommand
PS C:\Windows\system32>
{code}

The download *does* seem to work in the Firefox and Edge web browsers, but curl also seemed to fail in negotiating TLS.

Perhaps the browsers are more lax... Did we make any recent changes to the TLS cert used for this API?

It may be that we need to add some additional code to the script, but the script was working as-is AFAIK.
author: matt.lord

toString: This issue is related to COMPASS-1173
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString: When I create a new index and check the box "Build index in the background" I would expect that once I hit "Create" the dialog goes away and I can keep using Compass while the index is being built in the background.
toString:
When I create a new index and check the box "Build index in the background" I would expect that once I hit "Create" the dialog goes away and I can keep using Compass while the index is being built in the background.

Instead, while it seems that the index is being built in the background, it takes minutes before the dialog goes away and I can use Compass again.
author: massimiliano.marcon

author: joy.sampoonachot

fromString: If a collection is read-only, a user should not be able to save any validation changes (validation rules, level or action, etc.). Ideally, we should disable any UI control related to editing validation rules.
toString:
If it is a read-only view, a user shouldn't have access to the validation info (validation rules, level or action, etc.). To do so, we display a zero state with a warning.

If a read-only user tries to update validation rules, the error should be displayed.
author: alena.khineika

fromString: Support additionalProperties option with the list of properties to specify which fields document should support. This doesn't refer to the level of enforcement but what is enforced.

We are looking for input to decide how to prioritize it, so go there, look for the suggestion, vote and leave comments. If you don't find it, feel free to create a new one.

fromString:
Atlas is already using Appcues and they have seen a high conversion for features after adding small hints via appcues.

This spike is about looking at how easy it would be to integrate appcues into Compass from the technical perspective.
toString:
Atlas is already using Appcues and they have seen a high conversion for features after adding small hints via appcues.

This spike is about looking at how easy it would be to integrate appcues into Compass from the technical perspective.


h4. Pricing
Pricing is quite high: according to Intercom we currently have about 50k MAU, and that is the upper bound of the $999/month plan. The next price bucket is "Let's talk".
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want more real estate for my stage editor
So that I can see everything I type into the editor without a lot of scrolling, even when my stage contains a lot of code.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
- When I am working on a stage, I can make the stage editor full-screen
- When the stage editor is full-screen, I can see:
    - The stage selector
    - The code editor
    - A way to reach the documentation/examples for the current stage
    - A way to delete the stage
    - A way to disable the stage
    - A sample of the data entering the stage
    - A sample of the data outputted by the stage
    - A way to access the agg. pipeline settings, in case I need to adjust for instance the timeout if the current stage is too slow
- When I close the full-screen editor, the changes I made are reflected in the “small editor” and the results in the preview are updated
toString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want more real estate for my stage editor
So that I can see everything I type into the editor without a lot of scrolling, even when my stage contains a lot of code.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
- When I am working on a stage, I can make the stage editor full-screen
- When the stage editor is full-screen, I can see:
    -- The stage selector
    -- The code editor
    -- A way to reach the documentation/examples for the current stage
    -- A way to delete the stage
    -- A way to disable the stage
    -- A sample of the data entering the stage
    -- A sample of the data outputted by the stage
    -- A way to access the agg. pipeline settings, in case I need to adjust for instance the timeout if the current stage is too slow
- When I close the full-screen editor, the changes I made are reflected in the “small editor” and the results in the preview are updated
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to set sample size, number of docs in preview and maxTimeMS
So that I have better control over how Compass is executing and displaying my pipeline.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
- There is a place in the UI where I can set sample size, number of docs in preview and maxTimeMS
- By default, these settings are set to the default that is in Compass today
- When I change one of these values, the new configuration is preserved across different Compass sessions
    - Q: Should the setting be per collection, per pipeline, or global? How does that resonate with tabs?

fromString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to understand what the different UI controls do
So that I know what is going to happen when I click on them.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
- When I am trying to use a button, toggle, or other UI element on the screen, I want to understand what it does. This can be achieved in different ways (not mutually exclusive):
    - The UI control is self explanatory
    - When I hover over the UI control, some sort of tooltip is displayed
    - Next to the UI control or as part of the tooltip, there is a link to a documentation page with the details

fromString:
h3.User story
As a Compass user
I want to be able to open collections in different tabs
So that I have a quick way to switch from one collection from another, from one task to another 

h3.Acceptance Criteria
- When I am looking at Compass, I have the choice to organize my work with collections across multiple tabs
    -- I can use only one tab, and that tab will work as Compass work today
    -- I can open a collection in a new tab
    -- I can open the same collection I am workin on in a different tab
- Tabs are independent one from the other, I can have  the schema analyzer for Collection A in one tab and the Agg. Pipeline Builder in a different tab.
toString:
h3. User story

As a Compass user
 I want to be able to open collections in different tabs
 So that I have a quick way to switch from one collection from another, from one task to another
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I am looking at Compass, I have the choice to organize my work with collections across multiple tabs
 -- I can use only one tab, and that tab will work as Compass work today
 -- I can open a collection in a new tab (no matter to which database the collection belongs)
 -- I can open the same collection I am workin on in a different tab
 - Tabs are independent one from the other, I can have the schema analyzer for Collection A in one tab and the Agg. Pipeline Builder in a different tab.
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to see visible, friendly, helpful and designed error messages
So that I understand if Compass is broken or if instead there is actually something wrong with my connection/cluster/permissions.

h3. Acceptance criteria
- When I see an error, I want a user friendly explanation of what went wrong
- When I see an error, I want the necessary information to fix it or work around it
- When an error happens, I don’t want Compass to look broken
    -- There are very good reasons for some errors to happen (e.g. permissions problems for the current user). The errors we currently display make me think Compass was not expecting the error and therefore broke. We can probably make it look less broken if error messages are a bit more designed and communicate the problem with some copy we write instead of exposing the error from the driver.

h3. Notes
* Attached are some example of errors messages we currently have in Compass
toString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to see visible, friendly, helpful and designed error messages
So that I understand if Compass is broken or if instead there is actually something wrong with my connection/cluster/permissions.

h3. Acceptance criteria
- When an error happens, it should always be visible to the user
- When I see an error, I want a user friendly explanation of what went wrong
- When I see an error, I want the necessary information to fix it or work around it
- When an error happens, I don’t want Compass to look broken
    -- There are very good reasons for some errors to happen (e.g. permissions problems for the current user). The errors we currently display make me think Compass was not expecting the error and therefore broke. We can probably make it look less broken if error messages are a bit more designed and communicate the problem with some copy we write instead of exposing the error from the driver.

h3. Notes
* Attached are some example of errors messages we currently have in Compass
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want a simple connect screen
So that I better understand what information I need to fill in for my connection.

h3. Acceptance criteria
- When I open Compass and I see the connect screen, only the most common options are visible
    -- Hostname
    -- Port
    -- Whether or not I am taking advantage of the SRV record
    -- What kind of authentication I want to use (default is none)
        --- Depending on the authentication, other fields may be shown or hidden
- Other options can be hidden so they do not distract the user, but can be displayed if needed
- Once the connection details are filled in, the user can connect or save the connection as a favorite
- All the connection details should fit in one screen, scrolling should not be necessary
toString:
h3. User story

As a Compass user
 I want a simple connect screen
 So that I better understand what information I need to fill in for my connection.
h3. Acceptance criteria
 - When I open Compass and I see the connect screen, only the most common options are visible
 -- Hostname
 -- Port
 -- Whether or not I am taking advantage of the SRV record
 -- What kind of authentication I want to use (default is none)
 --- Depending on the authentication, other fields may be shown or hidden
 - Other options can be hidden so they do not distract the user, but can be displayed if needed
 - Once the connection details are filled in, the user can connect or save the connection as a favorite
 - All the connection details should fit in one screen, scrolling should not be necessary
 - Auto-detection of URI string in clipboard is still available
author: massimiliano.marcon

toString:
h3. User story

As a Compass user
 I want a simple connect experience
 So that I better understand what information I need to fill in for my connection.
h3. Acceptance criteria
 - When I open Compass, the default connect screen only includes a field where for the URI connection string.
 - It is possible to switch to a more advanced connection screen containing all the options
 - When there is a URI connection string in the clipboard, Compass asks the user if they want to use it
 - When I switch to the advanced view, connection details and options are logically grouped
 ** All the connection details should fit in one screen, scrolling should not be necessary
 - Once the connection details are filled in, the user can connect or save the connection as a favorite
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
 I want a quick and intuitive way to create schema validation rules
 So that I don’t have to remember the validator syntax and I don’t have to type anything when what I need is really simple
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I open the Validation screen, and the server I am connected to has version >= 3.6, I can choose to create/edit/delete my validation rules with a simple rule builder
 - The simple rule builder allows me to create simple rules to support a limited number of common use cases (e.g. type of a field, min/max, enum, to be defined)
 - Simple rules are created with an interactive mode rather than by typing code or JSON
 - When rules are created with the simple rule builder, they are translated behind the scenes into a JSON Schema
 - It should be possible to specify multiple rules for the same field
 - When I attempt to save a rule and the rule is correctly saved, I want to see a confirmation message
 - When I attempt to save a rule and the rule cannot be saved or there is an error, I want to see an error message
 -- This includes conflicts between rules detected by the server, or if we can detect that before saving even better
 - When I create a rule for a field, the field name should be autocompleted if there are already existing documents in the active collection
 - When I create a rule for a field, I should be able to type its name if it’s not already set for the documents already in the collection or if there are no documents in the collection

h3. Notes
- The > 3.6 topic may change in case of some push backs during the scope doc review
toString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
 I want a quick and intuitive way to create schema validation rules
 So that I don’t have to remember the validator syntax and I don’t have to type anything when what I need is really simple
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I open the Validation screen, and the server I am connected to has version >= 3.6, I can choose to create/edit/delete my validation rules with a simple rule builder
 - The simple rule builder allows me to create simple rules to support a limited number of common use cases (e.g. type of a field, min/max, enum, to be defined)
 - Simple rules are created with an interactive mode rather than by typing code or JSON
 - When rules are created with the simple rule builder, they are translated behind the scenes into a JSON Schema
 - It should be possible to specify multiple rules for the same field
 - It should be possible to specify that a document is valid only when all and only the fields that have been explicitly listed in the rules are present (i.e. {{allowAdditionalProperties: false}} is set for all the objects when the rules are translated into JSON Schema)
 - When I attempt to save a rule and the rule is correctly saved, I want to see a confirmation message
 - When I attempt to save a rule and the rule cannot be saved or there is an error, I want to see an error message
 -- This includes conflicts between rules detected by the server, or if we can detect that before saving even better
 - When I create a rule for a field, the field name should be autocompleted if there are already existing documents in the active collection
 - When I create a rule for a field, I should be able to type its name if it’s not already set for the documents already in the collection or if there are no documents in the collection

h3. Notes
 - The > 3.6 topic may change in case of some push backs during the scope doc review
author: massimiliano.marcon

toString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
 I want a quick and intuitive way to create schema validation rules
 So that I don’t have to remember the validator syntax and I don’t have to type anything when what I need is really simple
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I open the Validation screen, and the server I am connected to has version >= 3.6, I can choose to create/edit/delete my validation rules with a simple rule builder
 - The simple rule builder allows me to create simple rules to support a limited number of common use cases (e.g. type of a field, min/max, enum, to be defined)
 - Simple rules are created with an interactive mode rather than by typing code or JSON
 - When rules are created with the simple rule builder, they are translated behind the scenes into a JSON Schema
 - It should be possible to specify multiple rules for the same field
 - It should be possible to specify that a document is valid only when all and only the fields that have been explicitly listed in the rules are present (i.e. {{allowAdditionalProperties: false}} is set for all the objects when the rules are translated into JSON Schema)
 - When I attempt to save a rule and the rule is correctly saved, I want to see a confirmation message
 - Rules are always _and-ed_
 - When I attempt to save a rule and the rule cannot be saved or there is an error, I want to see an error message
 -- This includes conflicts between rules detected by the server, or if we can detect that before saving even better
 - When I create a rule for a field, the field name should be autocompleted if there are already existing documents in the active collection
 - When I create a rule for a field, I should be able to type its name if it’s not already set for the documents already in the collection or if there are no documents in the collection

h3. Notes
 - The > 3.6 topic may change in case of some push backs during the scope doc review
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
I want to see if existing documents match or do not match the validation rules I am adding
So that I can understand whether I am adding the right rules and whether my existing data would need some cleanup

h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I am specifying schema validation rules for a collection that already contains documents, I want to see a sample of documents that would match and would not match my validation rules
- The sampling of documents should happen with a reasonable level of performance
    -- If feasible with reasonable effort, the sampling would happen while I am editing the rules and not after saving, but this is not a strict requirement.
- If sampling is a long operation, the UI will not freeze or be blocked. Instead, we should display some sort of loading indicator in the area where the sample documents would appear.
    -- If feasible, where we show samples of documents that do not match the validation rules, we should highlight the fields that do not match
toString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
 I want to see if existing documents match or do not match the validation rules I am adding
 So that I can understand whether I am adding the right rules and whether my existing data would need some cleanup
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I am specifying schema validation rules for a collection that already contains documents, I want to see a sample of documents that would match and would not match my validation rules
 - The sampling of documents should happen with a reasonable level of performance
 -- If feasible with reasonable effort, the sampling would happen while I am editing the rules and not after saving, but this is not a strict requirement.
 - If sampling is a long operation, the UI will not freeze or be blocked. Instead, we should display some sort of loading indicator in the area where the sample documents would appear.
 -- -If feasible, where we show samples of documents that do not match the validation rules, we should highlight the fields that do not match-
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
I want to control validationLevel and validationAction for my validation rules
So that I can configure validation according to my needs

h3. Acceptance Criteria
- In the validation screen, there should be a way to toggle between strict and moderate for validationLevel
- In the validation screen, there should be a way to toggle between error and warn for validationAction
- When the user changes validationLevel or validationAction, he should be able to save the change
- For both validationLevel and validationAction, there should be a quick way for the user to access the documentation to figure out what they are
toString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
 I want to control validationLevel and validationAction for my validation rules
 So that I can configure validation according to my needs
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - In the validation screen, there should be a way to choose between off, strict and moderate for validationLevel
 - In the validation screen, there should be a way to toggle between error and warn for validationAction
 - When the user changes validationLevel or validationAction, he should be able to save the change
 - For both validationLevel and validationAction, there should be a quick way for the user to access the documentation to figure out what they are
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
I want some help when writing my validation rules
So that I don’t need to remember the syntax of the validation operators, properties and their allowed values and the name of the fields of existing documents

h3. Acceptance Criteria
- When I start typing the name of an existing field, an operator, a type or other keywords, the editor should suggest possible values
    -- Suggestions should be contextual, e.g. I should not be suggested a field name when I should be specifying the expected type of a field
- Autocompletion should work both for query operators as well as for JSON schema (including all the keywords specified here: http://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/operator/query/jsonSchema/#op._S_jsonSchema)
- When I get suggested possible values, I should be able to select one of the suggestions
- If none of the values that are suggested is the one I want, I should be able to type a different one
    -- A good use case for this is when I am creating validation rules for a field that does not exist in the documents already in the collection or when I am inserting rules for an empty collection: in these cases I should be able to type the field name even if it is not autocompleted
- The editor should support syntax highlighting for validation rules
- The editor should highlight errors and ideally give the user some hints on what the error is about
toString:
h3. User Story

As a Compass user
 I want some help when writing my validation rules
 So that I don’t need to remember the syntax of the validation operators, properties and their allowed values and the name of the fields of existing documents
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - When I start typing the name of an existing field, an operator, a type or other keywords, the editor should suggest possible values
 -- Ideally, suggestions should be contextual, e.g. I should not be suggested a field name when I should be specifying the expected type of a field
 - Autocompletion should work both for query operators as well as for JSON schema (including all the keywords specified here: [http://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/operator/query/jsonSchema/#op._S_jsonSchema])
 - When I get suggested possible values, I should be able to select one of the suggestions
 - If none of the values that are suggested is the one I want, I should be able to type a different one
 -- A good use case for this is when I am creating validation rules for a field that does not exist in the documents already in the collection or when I am inserting rules for an empty collection: in these cases I should be able to type the field name even if it is not autocompleted
 - The editor should support syntax highlighting for validation rules
 - The editor should highlight errors and ideally give the user some hints on what the error is about
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
As a Compass user
I want to see, create and modify schema validation rules for my collections
so that I can guarantee that my data will always be in the shape I expect

 
h4. Acceptance Criteria

* In Compass, when I select a collection I can access a Validation screen for that collection
* The Validation screen displays the validation rules currently associated with the collection
** By validation rules, we mean the object associate to the validator property
* The Validation screen allows the user to edit and save validation rules
* When there are no validation rules for the collection, there is a CTA for the user to start taking advantage of schema validation and a link pointing to the documentation
* When I access the validation screen for a collection with validation rules, all the rules are displayed, no matter if they are written with query expressions or as JSON Schema
* I can edit rules both as query expressions as well as in JSON Schema
* When I attempt to save a rule and the rule is correctly saved, I want to see a confirmation message
* When I attempt to save a rule and the rule cannot be saved or there is an error, I want to see an error message
** This includes conflicts between rules detected by the server

 * When I attempt to save a rule and the rule cannot be saved or there is an error, I want to see an error message

As a Compass user
I want to see, create and modify schema validation rules for my collections
so that I can guarantee that my data will always be in the shape I expect

h3. Acceptance Criteria

toString:
A new Compass plugin should allow to create, edit, delete, and configure JSON schema validation.

For a start it should work in Advanced mode only (entire validator as editable JSON). User can type JSON schema validation rules in ace editor. User’s input should be validated by query parser.

Resulting validation should be saved via updateCollection: https://github.com/10gen/compass-document-validation/blob/master/src/stores/index.js#L483
author: alena.khineika

For a start it should work in Advanced mode only (entire validator as editable JSON). User can type JSON schema validation rules in ace editor. User’s input should be validated by query parser.

Resulting validation should be saved via updateCollection: https://github.com/10gen/compass-document-validation/blob/master/src/stores/index.js#L483

fromString: After saving a valid $regex query as a favorite (likely recent as well) and then restarting Compass, the query is converted to a RegExp() query that is rejected by Compass.
toString:
After saving a valid $regex query as a favorite (likely recent as well) and then restarting Compass, the query is converted to a RegExp() query that is rejected by Compass.

Initially, the query is saved as a favorite that can be reused, see the screenshot: {{valid_regex_as_favorite_before_restart.png}}.

After restarting Compass, that same query is not in RegExp() format and no longer considered valid by Compass.   See the screenshot: {{}}.
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
After saving a valid $regex query as a favorite (likely recent as well) and then restarting Compass, the query is converted to a RegExp() query that is rejected by Compass.

Initially, the query is saved as a favorite that can be reused, see the screenshot: {{valid_regex_as_favorite_before_restart.png}}.

After restarting Compass, that same query is not in RegExp() format and no longer considered valid by Compass.   See the screenshot: {{}}.
toString:
After saving a valid $regex query as a favorite (likely recent as well) and then restarting Compass, the query is converted to a RegExp() query that is rejected by Compass.

Initially, the query is saved as a favorite that can be reused, see the screenshot: {{valid_regex_as_favorite_before_restart.png}}.

After restarting Compass, that same query is not in RegExp() format and no longer considered valid by Compass.   See the screenshot: {{invalid_regexp_after_compass_restart.png}}.
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
After saving a valid $regex query as a favorite (likely recent as well) and then restarting Compass, the query is converted to a RegExp() query that is rejected by Compass.

Initially, the query is saved as a favorite that can be reused, see the screenshot: {{valid_regex_as_favorite_before_restart.png}}.

After restarting Compass, that same query is not in RegExp() format and no longer considered valid by Compass.   See the screenshot: {{invalid_regexp_after_compass_restart.png}}.
toString:
After saving a valid $regex query as a favorite (likely recent as well) and then restarting Compass, the query is converted to a RegExp() query that is rejected by Compass.

Initially, the query is saved as a favorite that can be reused, see the screenshot: {{valid_regex_as_favorite_before_restart.png}}.

After restarting Compass, that same query is now in RegExp() format (instead of $regex) and no longer considered valid by Compass. See the screenshot: {{invalid_regexp_after_compass_restart.png}}.
author: brian.blevins

toString:
In preparation for demoing pipeline builder at MongoDB.local in Austin, I imported Asya's pipeline.  The pipeline works initially, but if you disable the last stage then re-enable it, you receive an error message saying "{color:#FF0000}Each element of the 'pipeline' array must be an object{color}".

If a re-create the pipeline manually, I do not see this behavior.  

Steps to re-create:
 # In a terminal (with a small font), "cat" the attached file, select the full text for the file and copy to clipboard
 # On Aggregations tab, click ... and select "New Pipeline From Text"
 # Paste the clipboard contents into the text area.
 # Click the "Create New" button
 # On the resulting pipeline, scroll down to the last stage and disable it
 # Re-enable that stage and the error is displayed
author: scott.stokes

toString:
I'm using Compass version 1.15.2. In preparation for demoing pipeline builder at MongoDB.local in Austin, I imported Asya's pipeline.  The pipeline works initially, but if you disable the last stage then re-enable it, you receive an error message saying "{color:#ff0000}Each element of the 'pipeline' array must be an object{color}".

If a re-create the pipeline manually, I do not see this behavior.  

Steps to re-create:
 # In a terminal (with a small font), "cat" the attached file, select the full text for the file and copy to clipboard
 # On Aggregations tab, click ... and select "New Pipeline From Text"
 # Paste the clipboard contents into the text area.
 # Click the "Create New" button
 # On the resulting pipeline, scroll down to the last stage and disable it
 # Re-enable that stage and the error is displayed

I recreated the pipeline manually and it works fine.
author: scott.stokes

{quote}
I’m getting ready for keynote in Chicago and I ran into the dragged stage disappears bug again - but I thought it was fixed (I’m on 1.16-beta3)
 !Screenshot 2018-09-10 10.17.35.png|thumbnail! 

I just dragged stage that was after $project before it
{quote}

No errors in devtools console, only warnings about count and find options.

The "thought this was fixed" is referring back to [this commit|https://github.com/mongodb-js/compass-aggregations/commit/2a13718e53ee0557134edbeb904381cf63b8472c].

fromString: No support for negative regex, { $not /regex/ } not accepted in query bar
toString: No support for negative regex, { $not: /regex/ } not accepted in query bar
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
In the mongo shell, the $not operator is allowed and documented for use against regular expressions.

[$not|https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/operator/query/not/#not]

{{db.inventory.find( \{ item: { $not: /^p.*/ } } )}}

However, the Compass query bar does not accept this query.

Please refer to the screenshots with both standard regex expression and $regex.
toString:
In the mongo shell, the $not operator is allowed and documented for use against regular expressions.

[$not|https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/operator/query/not/#not]

{{db.inventory.find( \{ item: \{ $not: /^p.*/ \} \} )}}

However, the Compass query bar does not accept this query.

Please refer to the screenshots with both standard regex expression and $regex.
author: brian.blevins

from:
I originally wrote the following mail to the Compass support who redirected me to here. I see this even more drastic since Compass is not useable because of this.

Here is my post :

 

Hi, just came back from MongoDB.local and thought I have to give Compass another try, since many cool new features have been build-in now.

BUT, I don’t get it, the main problem I had before is still there and its sooo simple to change and I do not even understand how anybody can life with it.

The visibility of the collection names in the navigation bar to the left is not resizeable or at least scrollable.

If you have collections starting with the same prefix you actually cannot see the important right part of the name. Why, what ?? ALL other MongoDB Clients I have been using are able to size up their left navigation bar. Only Compass is not able to do that. This simple missing “feature” – is it really a feature, I would call it common sense – makes Compass for us unusable. What a pity.

E.g. for some collections.

companyname.factory.side.name1

companyname.factory.side.name2

companyname.factory.side.name3

companyname.factory.side.name4

companyname.factory.side.name5

…

In Compass you only see

companyname.factory.sid

companyname.factory.sid

companyname.factory.sid

companyname.factory.sid

companyname.factory.sid

…

Without words.

Regards, Robert Weissmann
author: wir33658

fromString:
HIPAA regulation § 164.312(a)(2)(iii) states:

"Implement electronic procedures that terminate an electronic session after a predetermined time of inactivity."

Compass should provide a configurable inactivity or idle timeout to disconnect from the database server when there has been no further user interaction.
toString:
HIPAA regulation § 164.312(a)(2)(iii) states:

"Implement electronic procedures that terminate an electronic session after a predetermined time of inactivity."

Compass should provide a configurable inactivity or idle timeout to disconnect from the database server when there has been no further user interaction.  This setting/function is also known as "automatic logoff".
author: brian.blevins

fromString: Connection window validation for SSH tunnel in correctly reports missing port number when user password missing
toString: Connection window validation for SSH tunnel incorrectly reports missing port number when user password missing
author: anna.herlihy@10gen.com

fromString:
In Compass 1.15.0 on Mac OSX when using SSH tunneling, failing to provide the password for Username/Password authentication causes the port validation for the SSH tunnel to incorrectly report a missing port number.  Refer to the attached screenshot.

The user experience problem may be exacerbated by the flag for the missing password not being visible due to having scrolled above the top of the window.  See [COMPASS-3039: Poor user experience due to vertical scrolling in the Connect to Host dialog|https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/COMPASS-3039].
toString:
In Compass 1.15.0 on Mac OSX when using SSH tunneling, failing to provide the password for Username/Password authentication causes the port validation for the SSH tunnel to incorrectly report a missing port number.  Refer to the attached screenshot.

The user experience problem may be exacerbated by the flag for the missing password not being visible due to having scrolled above the top of the window.  See [COMPASS-3039: Poor user experience due to vertical scrolling in the Connect to Host dialog|https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/COMPASS-3039].
author: massimiliano.marcon

toString: This issue is related to INT-1734
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
Compass should support extended JSON strict mode queries in queries on the Documents, Schema and Explain Plan tabs.

The error message in Compass 1.14.7 for a "$oid" query is:

unknown operator: $oid
toString:
Compass should support extended JSON strict mode queries in queries on the Documents, Schema and Explain Plan tabs.

As an example, the error message in Compass 1.14.7 for an "$oid" query is:

unknown operator: $oid

For input languages such as Java, all extended JSON operators should be supported, so $regex, $date etc also need to work.
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
* setup [rust-clippy|https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rust-clippy]
 * setup [rustfmt|https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rustfmt]
 * setup ci to include rust-clippy and rustfmt check
 * setup ci to make sure wasm pack can be build
 * setup github-templates
 * setup [wasm-pack|https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-pack] (abstraction over [wasm-bindgen|https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-bindgen])
 * setup error types and error kinds for entire project (should be set up from the start to avoid adhoc errors mid way through project)
 * look into existing project figure out api endpoints and what will need to be exposed to wasm-pack/wasm-bindgen
 * setup struct outlines + behaviour/tickets for those structs – this is more of an api task
 * check 'clone' and 'debug' are implemented for all structs
 * figure out how to do testing with rust's internal test framework / possibly look into [quickcheck|https://github.com/BurntSushi/quickcheck] for model testing
 * #![deny(unsafe_code)]
 * documentation for all of the above ^

 * setup [rustfmt|https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rustfmt]
 * -setup ci to include rust-clippy and rustfmt check-
 * setup ci to make sure wasm pack can be build
 * setup github-templates
 * setup [wasm-pack|https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-pack] (abstraction over [wasm-bindgen|https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-bindgen])
 * setup error types and error kinds for entire project (should be set up from the start to avoid adhoc errors mid way through project)
 * look into existing project figure out api endpoints and what will need to be exposed to wasm-pack/wasm-bindgen
 * setup struct outlines + behaviour/tickets for those structs – this is more of an api task
 * check 'clone' and 'debug' are implemented for all structs
 * figure out how to do testing with rust's internal test framework / possibly look into [quickcheck|https://github.com/BurntSushi/quickcheck] for model testing
 * #![deny(unsafe_code)]
 * -deny missing docs-
 * -add code of conduct-
 * documentation for all of the above ^
author: irina.shestak

fromString: The auto-update and maps proxy currently run on Deis, which is being decommissioned by TECHOPS this quarter. Migrating to [the new platform|https://github.com/10gen/platform-docs] will dramatically increase reliability and provide long overdue monitoring and alerting. This is a multi-step project that will involve circling back with TECHOPS to update the DNS of these current services to point at the new platform containers.
toString: The auto-update and maps proxy currently run on Deis, which is being decommissioned by TECHOPS this quarter. Migrating to [the new platform|https://github.com/10gen/platform-docs] will dramatically increase reliability and provide long overdue monitoring and alerting. This is a multi-step project that will involve circling back with TECHOPS to update the DNS of these current services to point at the new platform containers. cc [~angelo.olivera]

fromString:
Users are reporting the need to quickly delete all documents in a collection using Compass.

The standard workaround of dropping the collection and recreating it has a number of drawbacks for non-trivial collections.
* must recreate indexes
* must handle any existing views on the underlying collection
* must recreate any document validation

fromString: For the standard reasons of simplicity and security, I would like to create read-only views using Compass.  {{db.createView()}} is cumbersome to use in the shell.  Since Compass maintains a list of aggregations for each collection in the pipeline builder, this request is to allow the intuitive creation of views by selecting from a drop-down list of the aggregations already defined on the selected collection.
toString:
For the standard reasons of simplicity and security, I would like to create read-only views using Compass.  {{db.createView()}} is cumbersome to use in the shell.  Since Compass maintains a list of aggregations for each collection in the pipeline builder, this request is to allow the intuitive creation of views by selecting from a drop-down list of the aggregations already defined on the selected collection.

If Compass had a View editor tab, it could handle the following goals:
* create a new view from existing aggregations,
* list the views already defined on the selected collection,
* copy the aggregation from an existing view into a new named aggregation for manipulation in the aggregation pipeline builder, and
* delete an existing view.
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
Hello, I am trying to create the following aggregation pipeline but last step is not working.

[{ $match: /** * query - The query in MQL. */{  codigoInternoDelContratoIuc : "00000000000000000034208890"} }, { $project: /** * specifications - The fields to *   include or exclude. */{  "codigoInternoDelContratoIuc":1,  all_buck: {            $concatArrays: [ {$ifNull: ['$online', []]},'$buckets']        }} }, { $unwind: /** * path - Path to the array field. * includeArrayIndex - Optional name for index. * preserveNullAndEmptyArrays - Optional *   toggle to unwind null and empty values. */  "$all_buck" }, { $group: /** * _id - The id of the group. * field1 - The first field name. */{  _id: "$all_buck.codigoRmsOperacionExtendido",  mov: {    $mergeObjects: "$all_buck"  },  count:{$sum:1}} }]

For mergeObjects is expecting []... I have tried different version but it is not working. The same pipeline in the shell is working fine!
Thank you i advance,
Juan

fromString: Apparently it's not possible to create a DBRef in C# without making a "connection" instance, which is out of scope for the export feature.
author: anna.herlihy@10gen.com

toString:
[https://mongodb.github.io/mongo-csharp-driver/2.5/apidocs/html/T_MongoDB_Driver_MongoDBRef.htm]

 

Apparently it's not possible to create a DBRef in C# without making a "connection" instance, which is out of scope for the export feature.
author: anna.herlihy@10gen.com

fromString:
From HELP:

The customer in https://support.mongodb.com/case/00504807 has a M0 cluster [staging](https://cloud.mongodb.com/v2/590c6bbdd383ad02b799d51b#clusters/detail/Staging) that he is unable to connect to the Atlas cluster and stuck in `Loading Navigation`. He also raised a Compass Intercom Conversation in https://app.intercom.io/a/apps/p57suhg7/inbox/inbox/unassigned/conversations/13166662432.

From the provided screenshot, there is no observable error shown in the console. However, there are issues when connecting to the cluster, and it is unusual the Replica Set is marked as `2 nodes` in the progress.
I have attached the screenshot for this case. Please let me know if you need any further information. Thanks.
toString:
From HELP:

The customer has a M0 cluster [staging]that he is unable to connect to the Atlas cluster and stuck in `Loading Navigation`.

From the provided screenshot, there is no observable error shown in the console. However, there are issues when connecting to the cluster, and it is unusual the Replica Set is marked as `2 nodes` in the progress.
author: craig.homa

fromString: Compass users are increasingly asking for a version in their native language. So far, we have seen requests for Compass in French, Chinese and Spanish.

Compass users are increasingly asking for a version in their native language. So far, we have seen requests for Compass in:
 * French
 * Chinese
 * Spanish
author: massimiliano.marcon

toString:
A way is needed to configure the desired datatype for each field/column of a CSV file during import.

The standard approach used by other tools is to display a dialog after parsing the first line/lines and allow the selection of the datatype from a menu for each of the field/column names.

Another approach would be to define the second row of the CSV as a type only line, with the datatypes separated by commas.  Then a simple flag in the import dialog could signal that the second line in the CSV file should select the datatypes for each field/column.


{code}
Name,Address,Birthdate,Widgets,Mobile,Spend
$string,$string,$date,$numberLong,$string,$numberDecimal
{code}
author: brian.blevins

fromString: For a user with many namespaces, the auto-collapse of expanded databases on the left-side namespace view makes switching between collections cumbersome.  Currently the auto-collapse occurs when a user clicks a collection in a different database.  That causes all other expanded databases to be collapsed.  Please make the database auto-collapse behavior configurable.

toString: Aggregation Builder: Dynamic Height Document Scrollbars Inconsistent
author: fred.truman

fromString:
As a user connected to some deployment:
* Viewing the aggregations tab
* I notice that the documents in the collection preview do not have scrollbars
* [Expected] Document previews for each stage also do not have scrollbars
* [Actual] Document previews have scrollbars

I believe this is a side effect from the recent dynamic height document preview area to match an increased height in the expression input. Would be great if we can remove the scrollbars from the stage results preview to match the collection preview documents.

Screenshot attached.
toString:
As a user connected to some deployment:
* Viewing the aggregations tab
* I notice that the documents in the collection preview do not have scrollbars
* [Expected] Document previews for each stage also do not have scrollbars
* [Actual] Document previews have scrollbars

I believe this is a side effect from the recent change to dynamic height document preview area to match an increased height in the expression input. Would be great if we can remove the scrollbars from the stage results preview to match the collection preview documents.

Screenshot attached.
author: fred.truman

fromString:
The hover tooltips on the type probability bars for each field are missing in the latest beta version.

Here is a screenshot from an older Compass version, I can't get them to show anymore in Compass 1.14.0-beta.2.

 !compass-1.12.4.png|thumbnail! 

I also noticed that the Documents and Indexes HUD at the top now show N/A for everything. This may be a separate regression.

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-31 at 12.11.30.png|thumbnail!

fromString:
* Use {{BsonUndefined}} instead of null
 * {{java.lang}} is always imported, so don't need to use the full name.
 * Use {{SimpleDateFormat}} instead of {{toString()}}
 * Use {{toHexString}} instead of {{toString}} for ObjectId
 * Use {{BINARY}} instead of {{OLD_BINARY}} for Binary subtype.

https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/82

From: [https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/76]
toString:
* Use {{BsonUndefined}} instead of null
 * {{java.lang}} is always imported, so don't need to use the full name.
 * Use {{SimpleDateFormat}} instead of {{toString()}}
 * Use {{toHexString}} instead of {{toString}} for ObjectId
 * Use {{BINARY}} instead of {{OLD_BINARY}} for Binary subtype.
 * Use Document constructor, so generate "\{x: 1}" as "new Document("x", 1)" and not "new Document().append("x", 1)"
 * Remove Code.toString() for JS and Shell because the result is just "\ [object Object\]"

[https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/82] 

https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/84

Comments from: [https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/76]
author: anna.herlihy@10gen.com

 * Use {{SimpleDateFormat}} instead of {{toString()}}
 * Use {{toHexString}} instead of {{toString}} for ObjectId
 * Use {{BINARY}} instead of {{OLD_BINARY}} for Binary subtype.
 * Use Document constructor, so generate "\{x: 1}" as "new Document("x", 1)" and not "new Document().append("x", 1)"
 * Remove Code.toString() for JS and Shell because the result is just "\ [object Object\]"

[https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/82] 

https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/84

 * Use {{SimpleDateFormat}} instead of {{toString()}}
 * Use {{toHexString}} instead of {{toString}} for ObjectId
 * Use {{BINARY}} instead of {{OLD_BINARY}} for Binary subtype.
 * Use Document constructor, so generate "\{x: 1}" as "new Document("x", 1)" and not "new Document().append("x", 1)"
 * Remove Code.toString() for JS and Shell because the result is just "[object Object]"

[https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/82] 

[https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/84]

Comments from: [https://github.com/mongodb-js/bson-compilers/pull/76]
author: anna.herlihy@10gen.com

fromString:
There are a few things that need to be explained in a wiki about how this project works. That way if people want to contribute, it'll be easier for them to get started. Should include:

1) Symbol tables
 * how are these generated
 * how does the hierarchy work
 * what happens to them afterwards

2) Visitors and Generators. How do we end up with ctx being "passed down" from visitor to generator?

3) What happens once Antlr generates the AST? what do we do from there?

4) Diagram to explain the javascript visitor structure.

5) Maybe a few more diagrams if they prove useful
toString:
There are a few things that need to be explained in a wiki about how this project works. That way if people want to contribute, it'll be easier for them to get started. Also useful for other teams that will be using this package. Should include:

1) Symbol tables
 * how are these generated
 * how does the hierarchy work
 * what happens to them afterwards

2) Visitors and Generators. How do we end up with ctx being "passed down" from visitor to generator?

3) What happens once Antlr generates the AST? what do we do from there?

4) Diagram to explain the javascript visitor structure.

5) Maybe a few more diagrams if they prove useful
author: irina.shestak

toString: This issue is related to COMPASS-3295
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
As an author, I want to adjust the width of the column where I author my pipelines, especially when using large res screens.

It's ok to still have the min width set (current one seems fine).

Once I change the width, it should persist so that I don't need to reset it every time I restart Compass.
toString:
h3. User story

As a Compass user
I want to adjust the width of the column where I author my pipelines
 So that I can adjust the editor interface according to my screen and my needs
h3. Acceptance Criteria
 - It's possible to change the width of the editor column in the aggregation pipeline builder
 - The width is not expected to be changeable for single stages but rather for the whole screen
 - Width configuration is persisted across sessions and application restarts
 - Resizing the column should have reasonable performance and feel smooth. If it's not the case, then we can park this for now and do COMPASS-3295 instead.
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString: Replace the “Add Stage” button  at the end (bottom) of the pipeline with a plus button next to the Delete button for each stage. When clicked, it inserts a new stage right after the one that is currently selected. This will help avoid a lot of vertical scrolling and also unnecessary movement/dragging of stages when you want to simply insert a stage in the middle of a pipeline, which is very common when authoring/debugging agg pipelines.

toString:
Discuss if we want to add a "buffer" support.
 * Right now it is valid to instantiate a JS Buffer only in the Binary object constructor. Should users be able to instantiate buffer data types outside of the BSON binary object?
 * Will people ever actually use it, outside of the BSON Binary type?
 * There isn't a shell equivalent outside of using the subtype like `md5(...data...)`.

toString:
Using a special character, such as `<`, causes an error with SRV record connection attempts, but not with hostname connection attempts.
{code}Password contains an illegal unescaped character
{code}
The password given in the screenshot is: {{a<b}}

The same password given with a hostname record correctly gives authentication failed.

 

Acceptance Criteria:
 * Compass connections using SRV records properly escape special characters in the password.
 * Compass connections using SRV records properly escape special characters in the username.
 * Supported special characters include: "@", "/", "\", "?", "#", "+"
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
The current version of Compass displays dates and times in the timezone of the desktop where Compass is running without indicating that it has been converted from the format it was originally stored in.  Compass should indicate the timezone being used to display the date and time, preferably with an option to use the ISO format.

The current approach to timezone is confusing and arguably incorrect with respect to the application server that is storing and using the timestamp information.
toString:
The current version of Compass displays dates and times in the UTC timezone (was timezone of the desktop where Compass is running) without indicating that it has been converted from the format it was originally stored in.  Compass should *indicate the timezone* being used to display the date and time, preferably with an option to use the ISO format.

* [ISO_8601|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601]
* The format: *2019-01-14T19:57:27+00:00*, displays the current timezone precisely.

The current approach to timezone is confusing and arguably incorrect with respect to the application server that is storing and using the timestamp information.
author: brian.blevins

fromString: As a DBA or developer, I want the option to see timestamps in ISO format with timezone
toString: As a DBA or developer, I want the option to see timestamps with timezone, preferrably in ISO format
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
Elisions in javascript: [,,1, 2] --> [undefined, 1, 2]

Won't work in java because doing `.append("array with leading elision", Arrays.asList(null, "1", "2")) will throw a null pointer exception.`
toString:
Elisions in javascript: [,,1, 2] --> [undefined, 1, 2]

Won't work in java because doing `.append("array with leading elision", Arrays.asList(null, "1", "2")) will throw a null pointer exception.`

fromString:
The Idea™ at the moment is to get start off in compass main repo and create a dropdown to include the current history feature and export to language. 

To trigger both history and export components, generate an event on the global app registry -- `global.hadronApp.appRegistry`.

Then get export to language to listen in the `store.onActivated` for the above ^ event to be dispatched.

A good example to see something like this working is in import-export plugin.
toString:
The Idea™ at the moment is to get start off in compass main repo and create a dropdown to include the current history feature and export to language.

To trigger both history and export components, generate an event on the global app registry – `global.hadronApp.appRegistry`.

Then get export to language to listen in the `store.onActivated` for the above ^ event to be dispatched.

A good example to see something like this working is in import-export plugin.

 

**Update:** use these two events to get the query bar – open-aggregation-export-to-language, open-query-export-to-language
author: irina.shestak

toString:
The Idea™ at the moment is to get start off in compass main repo and create a dropdown to include the current history feature and export to language.

To trigger both history and export components, generate an event on the global app registry – `global.hadronApp.appRegistry`.

Then get export to language to listen in the `store.onActivated` for the above ^ event to be dispatched.

A good example to see something like this working is in import-export plugin.

*Update:* use these two events to get the query bar – open-aggregation-export-to-language, open-query-export-to-language

*Update2:* once the event is 'caught' in store.onActivated, dispatch an event to be handled in export-query.js module. The event in export-query.js should change the state to have an inputQuery passed in from aggregation/querybar.
author: irina.shestak

fromString:
If the Compass user selects SSH tunneling and specifies an identity file with no content, there is no error message displayed when the user clicks the CONNECT button.

There is an error thrown in the DevTools Console:

{code}
/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/ssh2-streams/lib/keyParser.js:42 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at module.exports (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/ssh2-streams/lib/keyParser.js:42:18)
    at Client.connect (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/ssh2/lib/client.js:228:23)
    at SSHTunnel.createTunnel (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/lib/ssh-tunnel.js:53:4)
    at /Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:3866:24
    at replenish (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:998:17)
    at /Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:1002:9

    at Object.series (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:4721:5)

{code}
toString:
If the Compass user selects SSH tunneling and specifies an identity file with no content, there is no error message displayed when the user clicks the CONNECT button.

{code}
$ ls -alt .ssh/id_rsa
-rw------- 1 brian staff 0 Apr 20 10:34 .ssh/id_rsa
{code}


There is an error thrown in the DevTools Console:

{code}
/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/ssh2-streams/lib/keyParser.js:42 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at module.exports (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/ssh2-streams/lib/keyParser.js:42:18)
    at Client.connect (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/ssh2/lib/client.js:228:23)
    at SSHTunnel.createTunnel (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/lib/ssh-tunnel.js:53:4)
    at /Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:3866:24
    at replenish (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:998:17)
    at /Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:1002:9
    at eachOfLimit (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:1027:24)
    at _parallel (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:3865:5)
    at Object.series (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/node_modules/async/dist/async.js:4721:5)
    at SSHTunnel.listen (/Applications/MongoDB Compass.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/mongodb-connection-model/lib/ssh-tunnel.js:138:9)
{code}
author: brian.blevins

fromString: Add the ability to Copy/Paste a document
toString: Add the ability to Copy/Paste a document and to edit documents as JSON
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
Currently you can *Copy Document* but you cannot *Paste* a new document.  

It would be useful if there was the ability to create a document from the clipboard after copying it.
toString:
Currently you can *Copy Document* but you cannot *Paste* a new document.  

It would be useful if there was the ability to create a document from the clipboard after copying it.

It would also be great if we allowed users to create/edit documents as JSON in addition to the current editor which is great but very constrained
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
Currently you can *Copy Document* but you cannot *Paste* a new document.  

It would be useful if there was the ability to create a document from the clipboard after copying it.

It would also be great if we allowed users to create/edit documents as JSON in addition to the current editor which is great but very constrained
toString:
Currently you can *Copy Document* but you cannot *Paste* a new document.  

It would be useful if there was the ability to create a document from the clipboard after copying it.

It would also be great if we allowed users to create/edit documents as JSON in addition to the current editor which is great but very constrained. COMPASS-3503 was a request for that.
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
Atlas projects often have more than one configured database user account.  All database users are present in all clusters within the project.  When a customer uses:

* the "CONNECT" button on the Atlas user interface,
* Connect with MongoDB Compass,
* I am using Compass 1.12 or later:

the URL provided for connecting via Compass contains one of the database users for the project.  (the last one created?)

{code}
mongodb+srv://airNoRoutes:@freetestingcluster-5avn9.mongodb.net/admin
{code}

Sometimes it is necessary for the Atlas customer to overtype the Username from the URI with their own credentials.  For example, I regularly need to change the Username above to "brianblevins".

When they do overtype the Username this way, Compass 1.12.7 on MacOSX will hang during the connection without ever displaying an error message.  There is not obvious reason given in the DevTools console.

I have reproduced the problem with both the M001 student cluster and my own cluster above.  One must replace the Username for the problem to occur...however, this is relatively common.  I'll attach a screenshot of Compass 1.12.7 in the hung state.
toString:
Atlas projects often have more than one configured database user account.  All database users are present in all clusters within the project.  When a customer uses:

* the "CONNECT" button on the Atlas user interface,
* Connect with MongoDB Compass,
* I am using Compass 1.12 or later:

the URL provided for connecting via Compass contains one of the database users for the project.  (the last one created?)

{code}
mongodb+srv://airNoRoutes:@freetestingcluster-5avn9.mongodb.net/admin
{code}

Sometimes it is necessary for the Atlas customer to overtype the Username from the URI with their own credentials.  For example, I regularly need to change the Username above to "brianblevins".

When they do overtype the Username this way and then type the password (but not copy/paste the password), Compass 1.12.7 on MacOSX will hang during the connection without ever displaying an error message.  There is not obvious reason given in the DevTools console.

I have reproduced the problem with both the M001 student cluster and my own cluster above.  One must replace the Username for the problem to occur...however, this is relatively common.  I'll attach a screenshot of Compass 1.12.7 in the hung state.
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
Currently, undo/redo works only within a single text field. 

When inserting a document, if one accidentally changes a field type of a property, the value for the previous type is immediately erased with no way of bringing it back.
toString:
Currently, undo/redo works only within a single text field. 

When inserting a document, if one accidentally changes a field type of a property, the value for the previous type is immediately erased with no way of bringing it back.

fromString:
When using the copy document button on the Documents tab, the JSON copied to the clipboard is not sufficient to preserve data types such as date, binary, code, decimal128, int64, maxkey, minkey, objectId, bsonRegex, symbol and timestamp.

The attached screenshot shows the insert document dialog when attempting to drag/drop a JSON document with these types into a collection.  Most of the types are converted to strings, however, a few are incorrectly categorized as objects (including code, decimal128, maxkey, minkey).

The copy document generates a JSON document on one line.  Here is the example spread out for clarity.

{code}
{
"_id":"5ad749af86c98d53d48d55ab",
"stringType":"test copy document types",
"arrayType":["cell one","cell two","cell three"],
"binaryType":"W29iamVjdCBPYmplY3Rd",
"booleanType":false,
"codeType":{"scope":{},"code":"[object Object]"},
"dateType":"2018-02-11T09:45:54.000Z",
"decimal128Type":{"$numberDecimal":"986521.44"},
"doubleType":"3.14159",
"int32Type":1024,
"int64Type":"2048",
"maxkeyType":{"_bsontype":"MaxKey"},
"minkeyType":{"_bsontype":"MinKey"},
"nullType":null,
"objectType":{"subDocField":"stuff"},
"objectIdType":"5ad74b6d86c98d53d48d55ac",
"bsonRegexExpType":{"_bsontype":"BSONRegExp","pattern":"[abc].*[xyz]","options":""},
"symbolType":"alpha-particle",
"timestampType":"0"
}
{code}

fromString: Currently a view is distinguished from "normal" collection with a lock side its name. A more explicit way should be used to indicate a view.
toString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to distinguish views from collections
So that I easily understand what I am selecting in the sidebar or in the list of collections

h3. Acceptance criteria
- Views are represented with an intuitive icon in the sidebar

h4. Original description
bq. Currently a view is distinguished from "normal" collection with a lock side its name. A more explicit way should be used to indicate a view.
author: massimiliano.marcon

fromString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to distinguish views from collections
So that I easily understand what I am selecting in the sidebar or in the list of collections

h3. Acceptance criteria
- Views are represented with an intuitive icon in the sidebar

h4. Original description
bq. Currently a view is distinguished from "normal" collection with a lock side its name. A more explicit way should be used to indicate a view.
toString:
h3. User story
As a Compass user
I want to distinguish views from collections
So that I easily understand what I am selecting in the sidebar or in the list of collections

h3. Acceptance criteria
- Views are represented with an intuitive icon in the sidebar
- Views appear after Collections in the sidebar
- Views appear after Collections in the [Views and Collections screen|https://mongodb.invisionapp.com/share/ZKQDF41YGSJ#/screens/350992753]
- In the Views and Collections screen, Views are displayed with the collection (or view) they are based on

h4. Original description
bq. Currently a view is distinguished from "normal" collection with a lock side its name. A more explicit way should be used to indicate a view.
author: massimiliano.marcon

toString: This issue is documented by DOCSP-5826
author: jeffrey.allen

fromString:
Right now our test suite expects all translations to be symmetric, but that's not always possible (especially as our generated code gets more idiomatic). 

For example, `Code` in javascript can accept a function or a string, but in shell it only accepts a string.

Javascript --> Shell: `Code(function(){console.log};)` --> `Code("function(){console.log};")`
Shell --> Javascript `Code("function(){console.log};")` --> `Code("function(){console.log};")`
author: anna.herlihy@10gen.com

toString:
From the aggregation pipeline builder elipsis menu, the user can now select "New Pipeline From Plain Text". This will open a modal dialog where the user can paste in a complete aggregation pipeline in Shell syntax only.

If the user pastes and clicks "Create New", after confirmation the pipeline will be imported and displayed in the builder. If Auto-Preview is turned on, the pipeline will automatically execute.
author: durran.jordan@10gen.com

toString: compass.mongodb.com download api no longer works (Breaks server MSI installation)
author: mathew.robinson

fromString:
As part of SERVER-30995 we needed a stable download URL that we could hit to get the latest compass distribution for a platform.

Users have been reporting that the compass installation in the SERVER MSI is breaking the entire msi installation, this is because the URL's from INT-3194 are returning a 404 which causes our install-compass scripts to break.

fromString:
The following is a list of quick improvements we could make to the existing Aggregation Builder UI on Compass latest master before releasing beta. Most changes center on clarifying the actions towards the top of the UI and including a menu.

*Wireframes here:* https://mongodb.invisionapp.com/share/GHGQFPR8964#/289829837_00_-_Home_-

*Recommending that we:*
* Use a regular button in the action bar to invoke the saved pipelines drawer, rather than the sidebar corner square. I also think a FOLDER OPENING icon would do the job. (see font-awesome)
* Put the following actions into an ellipsis menu:
** Copy Pipeline to Clipboard
** Export Pipeline to Language (feature in-progress)
** Clone Pipeline
** New Pipeline
* Move the toggles next to the stage operator dropdown to get them away from accidental trash can clicks and stage removal.
* Have horizontal scrollbars always visible for the sample documents area
* Add Stage should be primary green for discoverability. I might even consider moving this all the way to the left side of the action bar. 
* Add a bigger ADD STAGE button that persists at the bottom of the last pipeline stage including/especially from the zero state.
* The arrows we have currently aren't really offering very much, and in fact users thought they might have been clickable. We should remove for now, but we'll have to try some more obvious cues around directionality. I have ideas I can try after beta is out.

cc [~durran.jordan]
toString:

*Wireframes here:* https://mongodb.invisionapp.com/share/GHGQFPR8964#/289829837_00_-_Home_-

*Recommending that we:*
* Use a regular button in the action bar to invoke the saved pipelines drawer, rather than the sidebar corner square. I also think a FOLDER OPENING icon would do the job. (see font-awesome)
* Put the following actions into an ellipsis menu:
** Copy Pipeline to Clipboard
** Export Pipeline to Language (feature in-progress)
** Clone Pipeline
** New Pipeline
* Move the toggles next to the stage operator dropdown to get them away from accidental trash can clicks and stage removal.
* Have horizontal scrollbars always visible for the sample documents area
* Add Stage should be primary green for discoverability. I might even consider moving this all the way to the left side of the action bar. 
* Add a bigger ADD STAGE button that persists at the bottom of the last pipeline stage including/especially from the zero state.
* The arrows we have currently aren't really offering very much, and in fact users thought they might have been clickable. We should remove for now, but we'll have to try some more obvious cues around directionality. I have ideas I can try after beta is out.

cc [~durran.jordan] [~craig.homa]
author: fred.truman

*Wireframes here:* https://mongodb.invisionapp.com/share/GHGQFPR8964#/289829837_00_-_Home_-

*Recommending that we:*

* Move the toggles next to the stage operator dropdown to get them away from accidental trash can clicks and stage removal.

* Add a bigger ADD STAGE button that persists at the bottom of the last pipeline stage including/especially from the zero state.
* The arrows we have currently aren't really offering very much, and in fact users thought they might have been clickable. We should remove for now, but we'll have to try some more obvious cues around directionality. I have ideas I can try after beta is out.

fromString:
This issue comes up from time to time in Intercom.  It is not a huge showstopper, but it certainly deserves a story for consideration by the designers.


> Is it possible to remove the chat button from compass? It overlays the "Update" button when editing a document
https://app.intercom.io/a/apps/p57suhg7/inbox/inbox/search/conversations/15586567934

> This button is covering up the App UI

fromString: Atlas SRV connection string causes Compass to hang during connection attempt
toString: Atlas SRV connection string causes Compass to hang after CONNECT click during connection attempt
author: brian.blevins

fromString:
Intercom customer reported that attempting to connect with Atlas connection settings was hanging Compass forever.

https://app.intercom.io/a/apps/p57suhg7/inbox/inbox/unassigned/conversations/15498640712

In Compass 1.12.4 on OSX I'm seeing the same behavior.  Compass connects to the cluster successfully using the Atlas connection string for 1.11 (without SRV record).  Additionally, I can use the same Atlas SRV connection string with the mongo shell to establish a connection successfully.

Also, I'm not seeing any DevTools output when the connection attempt hangs.
toString:
Intercom customer reported that attempting to connect with Atlas connection settings was hanging Compass forever.

https://app.intercom.io/a/apps/p57suhg7/inbox/inbox/unassigned/conversations/15498640712

In Compass 1.12.4 on OSX I'm seeing the same behavior.  Compass connects to the cluster successfully using the Atlas connection string for 1.11 (without SRV record).  Additionally, I can use the same Atlas SRV connection string with the mongo shell to establish a connection successfully.

Also, I'm not seeing any DevTools output when the connection attempt hangs.

The Intercom customer userid did not show any errors in BugSnag.
author: brian.blevins
